programme.title: Antiques Roadshow UK Detectives
programme.desc: Andy McConnell helps a daughter to discover the truth about her fathers working life at the Whitefriars Glass factory.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow UK
programme.desc: Back at Coughton Court, the experts get excited about an Agatha Christie letter, a medal awarded to those who came to the aid of the Titanic survivors and a rare figure of the Queen on horseback.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow UK
programme.desc: The team visits Sydney, Australia. Under scrutiny are pieces of furniture made by convicts, a part of the keel of Captain Cook's ship, and one collector receives one of the show's biggest valuations.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow UK
programme.desc: The team heads to the Cathedral cloisters in Norwich. Amongst the items are a letter from Lord Nelson, a series of portraits, and correspondence from John Lennon's Aunt Mimi.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow UK
programme.desc: We revisit the cloisters of Norwich Cathedral. The team uncovers original illustrations from Black Beauty and a rare saucer used for many years as an ashtray.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow UK
programme.desc: Michael Aspel and the team travel to Londonderry. Under scrutiny are the most intricately produced hand cut pictures to appear on the program, a cache of silver and a cushion woven from human hair.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow UK
programme.desc: Michael Aspel introduces unscreened finds including a pair of figures that narrowly escaped a bombing raid, a recipe book with hair raising potions and a painting by one of Queen Victoria's children.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow UK
programme.desc: Michael Aspel and the experts set up camp in Somerset. Amongst the items are a set of chairs that witnessed the battle of Trafalgar and a valuable postcard collection.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow UK
programme.desc: In Somerset, Michael Aspel and the team discover one of the rarest pieces of silver ever found on the Roadshow, a car powered by steam, and a set of original illustrations for Winnie the Pooh.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow UK
programme.desc: In the Royal Exhibition Building, in Melbourne, Australia, Michael Aspel and the team uncover relics from the days of gold strikes, a flag flown at the battle of Trafalgar and a sad looking bear.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow UK
programme.desc: Michael Aspel brings the season to a close with a reminder of this season's greatest finds and introduces follow up stories on some of the objects brought under the expert's scrutiny.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow UK
programme.desc: Michael Aspel and the team kick off their 30th anniversary celebrations in Hereford.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow UK
programme.desc: Michael Aspel and the team head to Arundel Castle in Norfolk for a second visit.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow UK
programme.desc: Michael Aspel and the team survey antiques and heirlooms in Northumberland.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow UK
programme.desc: The team survey antiques and heirlooms at England's last working Victorian pottery.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow UK
programme.desc: Michael Aspel and the team survey antiques and heirlooms in Bristol.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow UK
programme.desc: Michael Aspel and the team survey antiques and heirlooms at Coventry Cathedral.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow UK
programme.desc: Michael Aspel and the team take a trip to Banqueting House, in the heart of London.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow UK
programme.desc: Michael Aspel and the team unearth more treasures at London's Banqueting House.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow UK
programme.desc: Michael Aspel and the team are at Highcliffe Castle in Dorset.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow UK
programme.desc: Featuring the story of a watercolor purchased for two cigarettes in a WWII POW camp.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow UK
programme.desc: Michael Aspel and the team visit East Kirkby airfield in Lincolnshire.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow UK
programme.desc: Michael Aspel and the team pay a second visit to East Kirkby Airfield in Lincolnshire.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow UK
programme.desc: Michael Aspel and the team head to Exmouth on the Devon coast.
